title.narrative: Strengthening the Territorial Councils for Peace, Reconciliation and Coexistence (CTPRC)

description.narrative: The Peace Accords with the FARC guerrillas created the figures of Territorial Councils for Peace, Reconciliation and Coexistence (CTPRC), which are consultative and advisory spaces, created to promote dialogue, discussion, creation and implementation of strategies or activities that contribute to peace policies, through the promotion, implementation and dissemination of peaceful actions, reconciliation and coexistence at local level. The CTPRC include a wide range of participants from civil society such as representatives of women’s groups, LGBTI communities, victims association, as well as former members of the FARC-EP, as representatives of the movement or political party and local government and institutional representatives. By law, the Catholic Church is also part of these Councils. The aim of the project is to strengthen the participation of the Colombian Catholic Church in the Territorial Councils for Peace, Reconciliation and Coexistence and thereby strengthen the CTPRC. The Catholic Church is an institution that plays a leading role in peace processes. It has played a mediating role in the negotiations and in territories characterised by state abandonment it has positioned itself as an accompanying body committed to life, dignity and justice. The church's call to build peace from an active role of discernment of reality has been fundamental for its actions to promote the victim as an actor of agency and central to the implementation of the peace agreement.
